intro: Hieracium charadrotes, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive yellowish-green color, and its flowers bloom in shades of yellow to orange. Hieracium charadrotes is known for its hardy nature and ability to adapt to harsh mountain conditions.
